meanings.definition: A small square of fabric used for wiping the nose or face.
meanings.sent1: She always carries a mouchoir in her pocket in case she needs to wipe her nose.
meanings.sent2: He pulled out his mouchoir to dab at the sweat on his forehead.
meanings.sent3: The clown's trick involved pulling an endless string of colorful mouchoirs from his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: Her tears soaked through the mouchoir, leaving a trail of sadness behind.
meanings.sent5: The mouchoir was embroidered with delicate flowers, making it a cherished possession.

meanings.sent1: Grandma always keeps a lace mouchoir in her purse for special occasions.
meanings.sent2: He waved his mouchoir in the air to signal the start of the race.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a live rabbit out of his mouchoir, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: She tied her wishes to the corners of the mouchoir and let them fly in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The mouchoir smelled of lavender, bringing back memories of a summer long gone.
